Module kopper.tetris
Package kopper.tetris.core

Class BackgroundGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • kopper.tetris.core.BackgroundGrid
  • public class BackgroundGrid
extends Object

    A class that defines the background area of the Tetris game. All pixels of the Tetris game area reside within a GridCell. This class paints the entire area of the Tetris game. The Shape class then paints over the background its information according to the Coord objects inside the Shape model. When a shape is consumed by an object of this class using consumeShape(Shape), that object's data for cell color and cell location are inputed into this objects internal model representation of the background of the Tetris game. Therefore, this class draws the background of the Tetris game and occupied cells left over by "dead" colored cells of consumed "dead" Shapes. Programmatically, the shape object consumed by consumeShape(Shape) is dereferenced and collected by the Garbage Collector, while conceptually it and its dead cells stitched into this BackgroundGrid's internal model will be refered to as a "Dead Shape".

    Author:
    KopperKnight

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackgroundGrid

        public BackgroundGrid​(int x,
                      int y,
                      int gridWidth,
                      int gridHeight,
                      int columns,
                      int rows)
        Constructs a new Background Grid object.
        Parameters:
        x - the Xth pixel location of the upper left corner of the pixel area represented by this object. (x,y)=(0,0) represents the upper left most corner of GUI.
        y - the Yth pixel location of the upper left corner of the pixel area represented by this object. (x,y=(0,0) represents the upper left most corner of the GUI.
        gridWidth - the number of pixels wide the rectangular area represented by this object is.
        gridHeight - the number of pixels tall the rectangular area represented by this object is.
        columns - the number of columns of tetris blocks to be represented in this object. The GridCell created by this objects internal model will have the following property: cellwidth=(gridWidth-x)/columns;
        rows - the number of rows of tetris blocks to be represented in this object. The GridCell created by this objects internal model will have the following property: cellheight=(gridHeight-y)/rows;

    • Method Detail

      • getNextShape

        public static Shape getNextShape​(Coord coord)
        Returns a Shape of one of equal chance of being one of the following six subclass of Shape: ShapeI, ShapeJ, ShapeL, ShapeO, ShapeS, ShapeT, ShapeZ. This is a convenience method to be called upon when the game wants to spawn a new Shape.
        Parameters:
        coord - the absolute location of the returned shape should be located.
        Returns:
        A new Shape with location provided in parameters and an instance of one of the six Shape subclasses.

      • getNextShape

        public static Shape getNextShape​(int x,
                                 int y)
        Returns a Shape of one of equal chance of being one of the following six subclass of Shape: ShapeI, ShapeJ, ShapeL, ShapeO, ShapeS, ShapeT, ShapeZ. This is a convenience method to be called upon when the game wants to spawn a new Shape. This method is an overloaded version of getNextShape(Coord) and simply supplies the integer parameters to a new Coord object and calls that method.
        Parameters:
        x - The y component of the coordinate where the requested shape should be located.
        y - The y component of the coordinate where the requested shape should be located.
        Returns:
        A new Shape with location provided in parameters and an instance of one of the six Shape subclasses.

      • getCell

        public GridCell getCell​(int ro,
                        int col)
        Returns the cell represented by the cell coordinate provided. If the coordinate is outside the bounds of the paintable area, a dumby cell, representing all out of bounds cells with an overridden GridCell.drawCell(Graphics2D, boolean) and functionless method, is returned.
        Parameters:
        ro - The row of the desired cell's location in the grid of this class's internal grid model of GridCell objects to retrieve
        col - The column of the desired cell's location in the grid of this class's internal grid model of GridCell objects to retrieve
        Returns:
        the cell at the row, col location or in (col,row) if in (x,y) notation.

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Gets the number of rows present in this model's internal grid data.
        Returns:
        the number of rows in this object.

      • getColumnCount

        public int getColumnCount()
        Gets the number of columns present in this model's internal grid data.
        Returns:
        the number of columns in this object.

      • drawBackgroundGrid

        public void drawBackgroundGrid​(Graphics2D g2d)

        This method is named differently for various classes, but all classes that must paint representations of their data to the window, have some variation of a method drawOBJECTNAME(Graphics2D g2d); This is that method for this class.

        Note: TO BE REIMPLEMENTED AS AN INTERFACE DEFINITION implemented by all drawable classes in the future.

        This method is where the background model data represented by this object is painted to represent this object. Specifically, this object keeps track of each gridcell's color, whether it is occupied by a cell of a dead shape or empty space and the background color of empty space.

        This method is called via helper method TetrisGame.paintGameRunning(Graphics2D, kopper.tetris.core.TetrisGame.State), which in turn is called by TetrisGame.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics), which in turn is an overridden method ofJPanel's Container.paintComponents(java.awt.Graphics).

        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object ultimately supplied by overridden method TetrisGame.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

      • consumeShape

        public void consumeShape​(Shape s)
        Takes the individual colors and cell coordinates of the supplied Shape object copies those colors and coordinates into the internal grid model of this objects grid of cells. The shape is now painted as if it were the background represented by this object. Conceptually, this shape will be referred to as a dead shape. However, programmatically, the shape object is collected by the Garbage Collector and the reference to it is assigned a new Shape in the code for TetrisGame.
        Parameters:
        s - The shape to make part of the background.

      • canTranslate

        public boolean canTranslate​(Shape s,
                            int x,
                            int y)
        This method calls the supplied Shape's method Shape.trialTranslateShape(int, int) and compares the returned Coord object data to this object's internal model (a 2D boolean array) to determine if the the coordinates are supplied by a trial translation are already occupied.
        Parameters:
        s - The shape being tested for collision with occupied cells.
        x - The translation vector x component. Typically of magnitude one with + or - determining direction.
        y - The translation vector y component. Typically of magnitude one with + or - determining direction.
        Returns:
        True if none of the trial coordinates collide with occupied cells and False if otherwise, as defined by the private data of this BackgroundGrid object.

      • canTranslateDown

        public boolean canTranslateDown​(Shape s)
        A convenience method which calls canTranslate(Shape, int, int) with a downward vector of (x,y)=(0,1).
        Parameters:
        s - The shape being tested for collision with occupied cells.
        Returns:
        True if none of the trial coordinates collide with occupied cells and False if otherwise, as defined by the private data of this BackgroundGrid object.

      • canRotateCW90

        public boolean canRotateCW90​(Shape s)
        This method calls the supplied Shape's method Shape.trialRotateShapeClockwise90() and compares the returned Coord object data to this object's internal model (a 2D boolean array) to determine if the the coordinates are supplied by a trial translation are already occupied.
        Parameters:
        s - The shape being tested for collision with occupied cells.
        Returns:
        True if none of the trial coordinates collide with occupied cells and False if otherwise, as defined by the private data of this BackgroundGrid object.

      • canRotateCCW90

        public boolean canRotateCCW90​(Shape s)
        This method calls the supplied Shape's method Shape.trialRotateShapeCounterClockwise90() and compares the returned Coord object data to this object's internal model (a 2D boolean array) to determine if the the coordinates are supplied by a trial translation are already occupied.
        Parameters:
        s - The shape being tested for collision with occupied cells.
        Returns:
        True if none of the trial coordinates collide with occupied cells and False if otherwise, as defined by the private data of this BackgroundGrid object.

      • isOffLimits

        public boolean isOffLimits​(int r,
                           int c)
        This method determines of a cell is off limits to a live Shape. When the row and column supplied are with in the bounds of the drawable background, it returns the value of the internal boolean 2D array, which represents whether a dead cell occupies a location or not. Otherwise, when the row and column supplied are not within the drawable background, then the location is considered off limits in all cases EXCEPT when the row<0, which is the top of the screen (and where shapes spawn in the game off screen). This is the method used to keep shapes from going out of bounds left or right or falling down through the bottom of the game, when no dead shapes are on the bottom to stop a Shape.
        Parameters:
        r - The row in question (also known as the Y coordinate in Cartesian setup).
        c - The column in question (also known as the X coordinate in Cartesian setup).
        Returns:
        returns True if location is occupied by a dead Shape, is off screen to the LEFT or RIGHT or BOTTOM of the game. All locations that have no dead shapes or are ABOVE the game off screen return false.

      • isShapeDead

        public boolean isShapeDead​(Shape s)
        A Convenience method which calls canTranslateDown(Shape) and negates it. In other words, a Shape is considered dead if it cannot move downwards anymore.
        Parameters:
        s - The shape being tested as dead or not.
        Returns:
        True if shape is dead and cannot move down; False if otherwise; Is the opposite value returned by canTranslateDown(Shape).

      • detectFullRowsAndDelete

        public void detectFullRowsAndDelete()
        Detects any horizontal rows that are completely full of dead Shape's and removes them. This method calls and combines detectFullRows() and removeDetectedRows() into this one method. The same exact results can be achieved by calling these two methods in the order stated.

      • detectFullRows

        public int detectFullRows()
        This method searches all the rows for rows that are completely full of dead Shape's. The resulting indices are stored privately in this BackgroundGrid Object.
        Returns:
        Returns the total number of rows counted to be full.

      • getDetectFullRowCount

        public int getDetectFullRowCount()
        Returns the total number of rows counted to be full the last time detectFullRows() was called. If it wasn't ever called, or if rows detected previously have already been deleted by calling removeDetectedRows(), then it returns Zero.
        Returns:
        total number of rows counted to be full. Zero if never called before, or cleared previously.

      • removeDetectedRows

        public void removeDetectedRows()
        Removes all rows previously detected by the call detectFullRows(). If none were detected, then the method will do nothing as it operates on a for loop and the initial index value of for loop is 0 and the test 0<0 will fail before method's executes. This method will clear the number of rows detected to be full back to zero. Another call to detectFullRows() must be called again or else the number of full rows internally stored will remain at zero. This method removes rows in order of lowest numbered row (top of screen) first to the highest number row (bottom of the screen) last. This method calls removeRow(int) in a for loop. Do not override that method without considering this method also.

      • removeRow

        public void removeRow​(int row)
        This method is called in a for loop by removeDetectedRows(). This method removes the specified row All lower numbered rows less than the specified row number (higher on the screen) are shifted to one row higher numbered row (moved down on screen by one row). This method reduces the count of detected full rows by one, REGARDLESS of if the row specified is FULL or NOT. If the row removed is not full, a call to detectFullRows() should be called again to refresh the row count to the correct amount, otherwise a glitch can occur as the full row count would not be accurate in this situation anymore. If the number of detected rows is already zero, this method does not reduce the count of detected full rows any lower than zero.
        Parameters:
        row - The specified row to be deleted, can be full or not or empty.

      • isRowFull

        public boolean isRowFull​(int row)
        Determines if the number of dead shape cells in a row matches the number of row cells. This method is required by detectFullRows() for it to function properly.
        Parameters:
        row - The row in question.
        Returns:
        True if the row is fully occupied by dead shape's cells, False otherwise.

      • isShapeOutBounds

        public boolean isShapeOutBounds​(Shape s)
        Determines if a shape is completely in the drawable area. If even one cell of a given Shape is not in the drawable area, then it returns true. This method is used to test one of the GameOver conditions and is used in the methods TetrisGame.performOneGameTick() and TetrisGame.keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent).
        Parameters:
        s - The shape in question.
        Returns:
        True if even one cell of a given shape is outside the drawable area. False otherwise.
